Hi, fairly new to junit testing, I have this package where each class has a=

corresponding test case class. I ended up making a packeage test case that=

ran all the rest as well as some of it's own. I find myself writing a samp=
le
usage (outside the package) - something a client would do or use as an
e=
xample or maybe to load test. So I made this guy run the package test and
t=
hen his own tests. Seems like we will end up with some kind of hierarchy of=

tests.

We make web apps and do some web services, so we will have a few d=
ifferent
kinds of test (cactus, httpunut, ...)

I'm sure that the engineers=
 and qa people have been inventing this stuff for
50 years. Otoh, we may no=
t want to inherit all of that. faqs like
http://www.faqs.org/faqs/software-=
eng/testing-faq/ may be some kind of happy
medium?

I was wondering kinds o=
f hierarchies and what dependencies between the types
and levels of testing=
 that people who use junit have invented?

Any pointers will be appreciated=
.

Thanks
